headline: Mexican Families Are Wary of the Birth Control Clinic
snippet: TEPOZTLAN, Mexico Rebecca Martinez, 35 years old, her bare feet caked with mud, fatigue on her face, sat on a chair in her small front yard and cradled Emilio, 3 months old, her seventh child in 12 years.

headline: Britain's Cardinal Heenan, 70, Westminster Archbishop, Dead; Ecumenical Leader Spoke Out Against Birth Control, I.R.A. and Communism
snippet: LONDON, Nov. 7 (AP)-- John Cardinal Heenan, Archbishop of Westminster and the leading Roman Catholic prelate in England, Scotland and Wales, died here today. He was 70 years old and had been in failing health since early 1974.

headline: Catholic Churchgoing Off; Birth Control Stand Cited
snippet: BOSTON, Oct, 14 (AP) The  Roman Catholic Church's restrictions on birth control and divorce and the authority of the Pope are the main reasons why fewer Catholics are going to church, according to a national church-sponsored study.

headline: Birth Control Pills Are Recalled Due to Drop in Level of Estrogen
snippet: RARITAN, N.J., Oct. 14 (AP)  The Ortho Pharmaceutical Corporation here has recalled its Modicon birth control pills after tests showed that the level of estrogen, the active ingredient, had decreased in a small number of the pills.

headline: Study of Birth Control Pills' Role In Women's Coronaries Is Urged
snippet: The American College of Ob stetrics and Gynecology and Planned Parenthood agreed yesterday that more extensive, long-term research was needed on a reported link between oral contraceptives and heart attacks in women.

headline: Birth Control Zealot Ends Pacific Raft Trip
snippet: Maritime Safety Agency repts that Japanese contractor Koyohisa Ono, who was attempting to cross Pacific alone on raft to promote birth control, was rescued by fishing boat after he sent out distress signal when he lost propeller on his raft (S)

headline: Forewarning On Birth Control
snippet: LYNDONVILLE, Vt.--The Pill and the intrauterine device pose ethical problems that are unique, unprecedented.  "First, do no harm" is the ancient cornerstone of medicine, but today physicians are administering to healthy patients, for continuous...

headline: Sex Manuals Issued By China Sell Fast; Favor Birth Control
snippet: PEKING, July 19 (Agence France-Presse)--A series of manuals that has appeared recently in bookstores deals with contraception, sterilization of men and women and the sexual problems of teen-agers.

headline: If the Decision Is Abortion, What Is the Man's Attitude?; Informal Chats Reject Birth Control 'Best of Everything'
snippet: Some spend the four-hour wait enclosed in silence, Others, hungry for diversion, talk--mostly about sports. All look furtively at every newcomer who drifts through the waiting room for signs of recognition or,  worse yet, a camera.

headline: Louisiana Birth Control Expert Gets 2-Year Sentence for Fraud
snippet: NEW ORLEANS, April 23 Dr. Joseph Beasley, a widely known authority on population control methods who founded and directed a statewide family planning program in Louisiana, was sentenced to two years ...

headline: Louisiana Doctor, a Birth Control Leader, Is Found Guilty of Fraud
snippet: NEW ORLEANS, March 18 --Dr. Joseph Beasley, founder of the private foundation that provided birth control services to Louisiana's indigent women, has been found guilty, in the retrial of a Federal case that had ended two months ago with a deadlocked...

headline: Birth Control Devices: What Studies Show About Side Effects
snippet: "Birth Pill Linked to Strokes," "IUD Cited in 11 Deaths," "Pill Said to Cause Liver Tumors," "Doctor Fears Birth Pill May Increase Cancer Risk," "F.D.A. Seizes Unsafe IUD," "Senators Question Pill's Safety."

headline: Cancer Institute Chief Cautions On the Use of Birth Control Pill
snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 The so-called "morning after" birth control pill called DES should be banned if unnecessary use of it cannot be curbed, the director of the National Cancer Institute testified today.

headline: Study Shows Birth Control Pill Alone Can Increase the Chance of a Stroke
snippet: A follow-up study of strokes among young women has shown that use of the birth control pill by itself can increase a woman's chances of having a stroke. The study showed that this increased risk was present even in the absence of other risk factors...

headline: Drug Agency Keeps Ban On Birth-Control Shield
snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28 Dr. Alexander M. Schmidt, Commissioner of Food and Drugs, said today that a moratorium was continuing on the use of a contraceptive device called the Dalkon Shield.

headline: Birth Control Gains Support; Support Increasing For Birth Control
snippet: SOME members of the family of nations, after arguing long and loudly over the problem of population pressure, are now doing something about it, even as the controversy rages on.

headline: CLINIC FUND TRIAL ENDS IN DEADLOCK; Birth Control Director Was Charged in Fraud Count
snippet: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 25 The Federal Government's case against Dr. Joseph Beasley, di  rector of the multimillion-dollar private foundation that developed Louisiana's widely acclaimed birth control program, came to a halt this week because of a...

headline: F.D.A. Seized 25 Million Birth Control Pills in Dispute over Advertisements
snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31-- The largest seizure of a single prescription drug in the history of the Food and Drug Administration took place recently in an action against a concern at Pearl River, N.Y.
